title: Taylor Swift announces new album on 'New Heights' podcast. Latest updates
description: Swift is the guest on a special edition of her boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast this week. Here's what to know ahead of the episode.
content:
• Taylor Swift will be a guest on the "New Heights" podcast hosted by Travis and Jason Kelce.
• The episode will air on Wednesday, August 13 at 7 p.m. ET.
• This is Swift's first appearance on the podcast, though she has been a topic of conversation previously.

One of the most popular podcasts in sports will have a special guest this week.

Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce and his brother, Jason, will welcome Taylor Swift to their "New Heights" podcast. Swift and Travis started dating two years ago and have become the NFL's most popular celebrity couple. For the first time in their relationship, Swift will appear on the show.

"New Heights" teased a surprise show this week with a new guest. Many speculated that it would be Swift and the show confirmed those rumors with a clip from the upcoming episode.

If Swifties needed another reason to tune in, they got one. At 12:12 a.m. ET on Aug. 12, the show posted a clip from the upcoming episode in which Swift shows her new album "The Life of a Showgirl."

That's more than enough reason to tune in this week. Here's everything to know ahead of Swift's appearance on "New Heights" this week:

New Heights podcast, Taylor Swift live updates: What to know

When does the New Heights Taylor Swift episode come out?

The special "New Heights" podcast episode with Taylor Swift releases Wednesday, Aug. 13 at 7 p.m. ET.

Where to watch the New Heights podcast

You can catch the "New Heights" in both podcast and video format. It's the top show on Apple Music and also available on Spotify. In video form, it's available on YouTube.

Will Taylor Swift announce her new album on the podcast?

Yes, a clip from the upcoming episode shows Swift unveiling her new album "The Life of a Showgirl." It's her 12th studio album and the second in as many years after 2024's "The Tortured Poets Department."

Has Taylor Swift been on Travis Kelce's podcast before?

No, this is the artist's first appearance on the show but she's been mentioned many times over the last two years.

Travis first talked about going to one of her concerts on an episode in July 2023.

"I was disappointed that she doesn't talk before or after her shows because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs she sings so I was a little butthurt I didn't get to hand her one of the bracelets I made her," Travis said. "If you're up on Taylor Swift concerts, there are friendship bracelets and I had received a bunch of them, but I wanted to give Taylor Swift one with my number on it."

Two months later, the two were officially dating.

What is the New Heights podcast?

The show premiered on Sept. 7, 2022 when both brothers were active players in the NFL. Jason was entering his 12th and penultimate season with the Philadelphia Eagles as their starting center. He retired following the 2023 NFL season after earning his sixth career first-team All-Pro honor.

Jason's career with the Eagles and Travis' with the Chiefs means prominent people from both franchises have appeared on the show. Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts, general manager Howie Roseman, coach Nick Sirianni and running back Saquon Barkley have all appeared at least once on the podcast. Same goes for Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, defensive tackle Chris Jones and coach Andy Reid.

The podcast grew in popularity enough over the following two years that Wondery, Amazon's podcast platform, paid more than $100 million for the ad sales and distribution rights for the show.

Swift is one of the highest-profile guests the brothers have had on the show but she's not alone. Here are some of the more notable non-football guests to appear on "New Heights":

keywords.name: the New Heights Taylor Swift episode
Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce

summary: Taylor Swift will be a guest on the "New Heights" podcast hosted by Travis and Jason Kelce, which will air on August 13 at 7 p.m. ET. This is Swift's first appearance on the podcast, though she has been a topic of discussion previously. The episode will be broadcast from 12:12am ET on August 12. A clip from the upcoming episode shows Swift unveiling her new album "The Life of a Showgirl." This is not the first time the couple has appeared on the show. The podcast has become so popular that Amazon's podcast platform, Wondery, which paid more than $100 million for the ad sales and distribution rights for the show, is also available on iTunes and Spotify.
shortSummary: Taylor Swift will be a guest on Travis Kelce's "New Heights," airing on August 13, to announce her new album "The Life of a Showgirl."

scraped_sources.text:
Travis, Jason Kelce strike lucrative new distribution deal for their 'New Heights' podcast
Just in time for football season, NFL superstar Travis Kelce and his recently retired brother Jason have a new -- and extremely lucrative -- publisher for their popular "New Heights" podcast.
Amazon's Wondery will take over all ad sales and distribution rights for the Kelce brothers' weekly show as part of the agreement announced Tuesday.
"Wondery understands the shared vision and will offer a wealth of experience and resources to take us to new heights!" Travis and Jason Kelce said in a statement. "We are going to create some groundbreaking moments together through this partnership. We are thrilled to start Season 3 — see you soon, 92%ers!"
Variety reports the deal is for three years and more than $100 million.
The Kelce brothers began their "New Heights" podcast two years ago and it has grown into what Wondery CEO Jen Sargent calls "a cultural phenomenon."
In addition to their insider football knowledge from a combined 24 years in the NFL, the Kelces often tap into their personal lives, pop culture and other random topics on their podcast. And of course, the show's popularity gained even greater visibility from Travis Kelce's budding romance with musical megastar Taylor Swift.
The new deal will provide ad-free access to Wondery+ subscribers and allow the company to create new products and sell merchandise based on the "New Heights" podcast.
The USA TODAY app gets you to the heart of the news — fast. Download for award-winning coverage, crosswords, audio storytelling, the eNewspaper and more.

Travis Kelce talks being Taylor Swift's 'plus one'
For Travis Kelce, "plus one" is a badge of honor.
The Kansas City Chiefs' tight end, who has in recent years become arguably the most famous boyfriend on the planet, revealed in a recent interview that when your date is Taylor Swift, being a sidekick isn't half bad.
"I get to be the plus one," he told GQ in a cover story published Tuesday, Aug. 12. "I get to go and be that fan. Because I am a fan. I'm a fan of music. I'm a fan of art." Kelce, a star in his own right, was spotted by fans at several different shows throughout Swift's career-defining, local-economy-lifting Eras Tour. He even appeared on stage at one of them, joining Swift midway through a set of songs from her latest album, "The Tortured Poets Department."
The real-life equivalent of a joint Instagram post, Kelce and Swift have made their love the stuff of legends. She shifts her lyrics at shows to reference their romance. He points up at the box after a play, where she sits with her celebrity friends.
His interview follows a guest appearance teaser by Swift on the "New Heights" podcast, which Kelce hosts alongside his brother Jason. In it, she unveiled a new album (and likely era): "The Life of a Showgirl."
Swift, 35, chose to appear on Kelce's podcast rather than visiting a traditional news outlet. That's part of the charm of dating someone within the entertainment industry, Kelce says.
"I hadn't experienced somebody in the same shoes as me, having a partner who understands the scrutiny, understands the ups and downs of being in front of millions," Kelce, 35, told GQ. "That was very relatable, seeing how exhausted she would get after shows. She may not think of herself as an athlete. She will never tell anyone that she is an athlete. But I’ve seen what she goes through. I’ve seen the amount of work that she puts on her body, and it’s mind-blowing."
It's the intimacy that Swift creates, however, out of a crowd of millions, that stuns Kelce the most.
"People gravitate towards how she performs and how she makes it feel like the entire stadium is in this little room with her," he told the outlet. "She is so good at mesmerizing everybody and making everybody feel like it's an intimate situation. I think that alone – there is so much calm and coolness. She's beautiful. She's up there making everyone feel at ease."
He's not the only plus one, though.
"It's so cool that I get to experience her being that plus one for me on the football field," Kelce said. "I feel that same enjoyment every time she comes to my shows."

Travis Kelce gushes over Taylor Swift in GQ story: 'We're just two people that are in love'
Less than seven hours after Taylor Swift announced the title of her 12th album, Travis Kelce is gracing the cover of GQ magazine with a cover story diving into football, his next career move and life dating a superstar.
The Kansas City Chiefs tight end opened up about the blinding spotlight of being Swift's "plus one" and how he's navigating the pressure, in the more than 6,000 worded article written by Simon and Schuster publisher Sean Manning.
"When there is not a camera on us, we're just two people that are in love," Kelce said. "It can be perceived as something else because of how much it is talked about and how much we are tracked whenever we do go out, but I would say that it's as normal of. … It happened very organically even though from a media standpoint it was being tracked. It still happened very organically."
Kelce said one of the most refreshing parts of dating Swift has been realizing how similar their worlds are.
"I hadn't experienced somebody in the same shoes as me, having a partner who understands the scrutiny, understands the ups and downs of being in front of millions," he said. "That was very relatable, seeing how exhausted she would get after shows. She may not think of herself as an athlete. She will never tell anyone that she is an athlete. But I've seen what she goes through. I've seen the amount of work that she puts on her body, and it's mind-blowing."
Taylor Swift is 'electric,' Travis Kelce says in GQ
Kelce and Swift have dated since the summer of 2023, which Swift revealed began "when Travis very adorably put me on blast on his podcast, which I thought was metal as hell," she said in her Time magazine Person of the Year article.
"We started hanging out right after that. So we actually had a significant amount of time that no one knew, which I'm grateful for, because we got to get to know each other," Swift said in Time. "By the time I went to that first game," the Chiefs versus Bears game in September 2023, where she watched from a suite, "we were a couple. I think some people think that they saw our first date at that game? We would never be psychotic enough to hard launch a first date."
Kelce followed her to 14 concert stops along the Eras Tour, and she changed the "Karma" lyrics every night he attended to, "Karma is the guy on the Chiefs coming straight home to me."
In the GQ article, Kelce called the show "electric" and said he's amazed by the singer-songwriter's stamina.
"To go out on a stage, on a computer, essentially, for three hours," he says. "The (Eras Tour) floor is literally – I've seen underneath that thing. It is a football-field-sized computer. You take that into Singapore, where it is scorching hot, and all of a sudden you're feeling the fumes from the computer and you're feeling the fumes from the sun and you're doing a show for three hours with a lot of energy, bringing it every single song. That is arguably more exhausting than how much I put in on a Sunday, and she’s doing it three, four, five days in a row."
Taylor Swift's 12th era involves Travis Kelce
Swift included her boyfriend and his brother in announcing her newest project, "The Life of a Showgirl."
At 12:12 a.m. ET on Aug. 12, a "New Heights" podcast teaser video showed Swift and Kelce next to each other as she revealed to Jason Kelce the album cover.
Kelce has become the conduit of news for Swift. In addition to changing the lyrics, she invited him on stage during her showgirl portion of the show to carry her into "I Can Do It With A Broken Heart." She also did a last-minute surprise at Tight End University, an event he cohosts, performing "Shake It Off."
Although he doesn't say when his last season will be with the NFL, Kelce told GQ, "Nowadays, I just want to be respected and loved by the people that I’m surrounded by in my work.
"I want to leave it better than where it was when I started," he said, before invoking Swift. "And I see her having those same values."
Don't miss any Taylor Swift news; sign up for the free, weekly newsletter This Swift Beat.
Follow Bryan West, the USA TODAY Network's Taylor Swift reporter, on Instagram, TikTok and X as @BryanWestTV.

How Travis Kelce made Taylor Swift, his superstar girlfriend, a football fan
- Travis Kelce says Taylor Swift is a big football fan now, understanding game intricacies.
- Kelce enjoys being Swift's plus-one at her events, just as she is at his games.
- Swift announced her new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on Kelce's podcast, "New Heights."
Taylor Swift is a full-fledged football fan now, and it's mostly because of Travis Kelce.
The Kansas City Chiefs tight end declared this in a new GQ cover story released Tuesday ahead of the start to the 2025 NFL season. Swift, of course, has frequently been spotted at Kelce's games, particularly at Arrowhead Stadium, since the two stars began dating two years ago.
And it appears she's successfully been learning the intricacies of the sport thanks to her boyfriend.
"I sort of made her a football fan," Kelce said in the interview. "She is the most engulfed fan now. She knows what the injury reports look like. She understands what special situations are, third and short – all these things because she just naturally loves to hear about my job."
Kelce spoke on a number of topics with GQ, but the latest comments on his relationship with Swift drew crossover attention. The two have been a pop culture fascination the past two seasons, with Swift's appearances at Chiefs games to watch Kelce and Kelce's appearances at Swift's concerts chronicled worldwide.
Swift grew up in West Reading, Pennsylvania as a Philadelphia Eagles fan, and her song "Gold Rush" even includes a lyric alluding to her fandom. But those days are over. Kelce expressed satisfaction with their dynamic when supporting one another, and the reality that her celebrity overshadows his.
"I get to be the plus-one," Kelce said. "I get to go and be that fan. Because I am a fan. I’m a fan of music. I’m a fan of art. And it’s so cool that I get to experience her being that plus-one for me on the football field. … I feel that same enjoyment every time she comes to my shows."
Kelce did not talk about retirement from football in specific terms, but reiterated he's interested in remaining involved with the game once his career is over while also exploring a potential move into acting or entertainment. He recently had a cameo role in "Happy Gilmore 2" and served as the host of "Are You Smarter Than a Celebrity" on Amazon Prime. He also co-hosts the popular "New Heights" podcast with his brother, former Philadelphia Eagles center and current ESPN NFL analyst Jason Kelce, which is reportedly worth $100 million after being licensed by Wonderly last year.
Swift announced her new album, "The Life of a Showgirl," during a clip released on social media ahead of an upcoming appearance on "New Heights" on Wednesday night. It means Kelce has officially gone from coaching Swift up on football to collaborating with her on PR rollouts.
For football's most famous couple, it's yet another sign of a healthy relationship.
"When you see me hanging out at the US Open with Taylor, it may look like the two of us are partying," Kelce told GQ. "But I’m just enjoying the fun of being at this really cool event that I always wanted to go to with the person that I love."
When does 'The Life of a Showgirl' drop?
In a teaser social media video, Taylor Swift appeared with Travis Kelce on his podcast, "New Heights," which he co-hosts with his brother, Jason Kelce. During the episode, she revealed a mint green briefcase featuring her initials and announced that it contained her new album. On Swift's official website, there is a countdown leading to 12:12 a.m. ET, where fans can preorder "The Life of a Showgirl" on vinyl, cassette, or CD, complete with a poster.
No additional information has been disclosed yet, including the album cover image. Fans will have to wait until the "New Heights" podcast releases on Wednesday, Aug. 13, at 7 p.m. ET for more details.

Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce relationship timeline: How NFL games shaped superstar couple
The romance that has dominated the sports and entertainment headlines for more than a year now began at the home of the Kansas City Chiefs. Star tight end Travis Kelce attended a Taylor Swift concert at Arrowhead Stadium in July 2023. He later revealed to his older brother, Jason Kelce, on their "New Heights" podcast that he came armed with a personalized friendship bracelet with his phone number that he hoped to give to Swift.
Kelce never was able to give her the bracelet, but he eventually got to meet Swift once his plans to woo her at the concert went public. After weeks of rumors, Swift showed up in Kelce's Arrowhead Stadium suite for the Chiefs game against the Chicago Bears last September and their relationship became part of the national and international conversation, including whether Swift was being shown on television too much during Kansas City games.
Swift and Kelce are still dating as the 2024 NFL season begins with the Chiefs hosting the Baltimore Ravens in a rematch of the AFC Championship game on Thursday night. Some Swifties are hoping for a proposal soon. But football is likely to remain a featured setting in which to get a glimpse of the future Hall of Fame tight end and his superstar girlfriend.
Here's a timeline of their relationship and how the NFL is inextricably linked with perhaps the most famous couple on the planet at the moment:
WHAT WE KNOW: Will Taylor Swift attend the Chiefs game Thursday against the Ravens?
Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce relationship timeline
- July 8, 2023: Travis Kelce attended Taylor Swift's second concert at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri
- Sept. 24, 2023: Taylor Swift accepted an invitation from Kelce, made public during an appearance on "The Pat McAfee Show," and attended the Chiefs' 41-10 win over the Chicago Bears in Kansas City, Missouri. She sat with Kelce's mother, Donna, in a suite wearing a red-and-white Chiefs jacket. Kelce had a touchdown catch in the game and was later spotted leaving Arrowhead Stadium with Swift. Kelce reportedly rented out Prime Social Rooftop, a restaurant in Kansas City, for Swift, his family and teammates that night.
- Oct. 1, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 23-20 road win over New York Jets and came to MetLife Stadium accompanied by fellow celebrities and friends Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively, Hugh Jackman, Sophie Turner and Sabrina Carpenter. Kelce, who had seven catches for 69 yards in the game, was pictured leaving Swift's New York City apartment prior to facing the Jets.
- Oct. 12, 2023: Swift returned to an Arrowhead Stadium suite one day after the Los Angeles premiere of her "Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour" film when the Chiefs beat the Denver Broncos in a Thursday night game. Kelce had a game-high nine receptions for 124 yards.
- Oct. 14, 2023: Swift and Kelce appeared on the season premiere of NBC's "Saturday Night Live." Swift introduced musical performer Ice Spice. Kelce was in a skit poking fun at all the coverage his relationship with Swift had generated in the NFL.
- Oct. 22, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 31-17 win over the Los Angeles Chargers at Arrowhead Stadium with Kelce's parents and Brittany Mahomes, the wife of Kansas City quarterback Patrick Mahomes. Swift wore a No. 87 bracelet during the game.
- Oct. 30, 2023: The Denver Broncos played Taylor Swift's "Shake It Off" over the loudspeakers after beating the Kansas City Chiefs, 24-9, in Denver. Swift was not at the game.
- Nov. 3, 2023: Kelce was asked if he's in love with Swift during a news conference in Germany ahead of the Chiefs' 21-14 win over the Miami Dolphins. “I’m going to keep my personal relationship personal,” Kelce said.
- Nov. 11, 2023: Kelce attended Swift's concert in Buenos Aires, Argentina during the Chiefs' bye week. During the show, Swift switched the lyrics to her hit 2022 song, "Karma," to "Karma is the guy on the Chiefs, coming straight home to me."
- Dec. 3, 2023: Swift attended her first Chiefs' loss ‒ a 27-19 setback at Green Bay on Monday Night Football – and sat in a Lambeau Field suite with Brittany Mahomes.
- Dec. 6, 2023: Swift, in an interview with Time when she was named Person of the Year, commented on her relationship with Kelce for the first time. Swift revealed that she and Kelce started "dating" and "hanging out" soon after the concert Kelce attended in July and well before she came to the Bears game in September.
- Dec. 10, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 20-17 loss to the Buffalo Bills at Arrowhead Stadium.
- Dec. 17, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 27-17 road win over the New England Patriots along with her father and friends Alaina Haim and Ashley Avignone.
- Dec. 25, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 20-14 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders at Arrowhead Stadium with her parents and brother while wearing a Santa hat with No. 87 embroidered. Her brother dressed up as Santa Claus and Kelce later revealed on his podcast that Austin Swift gifted him a VHS copy of "Little Giants," his favorite football movie.
- Dec. 31, 2023: Swift attended the Chiefs' 25-17 win over the Cincinnati Bengals before spending New Year's Eve in Kansas City with Kelce.
- Jan. 13, 2024: Swift attended the Chiefs' AFC Wild Card round playoff win over the Miami Dolphins wearing a jacket emblazoned with Kelce's No. 87 to combat temperatures that dipped below 0 degrees at kickoff.
- Jan. 21, 2024: Swift attended the Chiefs' AFC Divisional round win on the road against the Buffalo Bills along with Jason and Kylie Kelce. Jason Kelce was shown shirtless chugging a beer in their suite at Highmark Stadium. Travis Kelce, meanwhile, made a heart gesture with his hands towards Swift's suite when he caught a touchdown pass.
- Jan. 28, 2024: Swift attended the Chiefs' AFC Championship Game win on the road against the Baltimore Ravens and appeared on field with Kelce for the first time. Swift came down from her suite for the on-field celebration after the Chiefs secured a spot in the Super Bowl along with Kelce's parents. She even had a moment with Chiefs coach Andy Reid.
- Feb. 11, 2024: Swift attended the Chiefs' win over the San Francisco 49ers in Super Bowl LVIII in Las Vegas one day after performing in Tokyo. During the game, Swift was shown on the Allegiant Stadium videoboard with Blake Lively and chugged her drink. After the game, she and Kelce embraced on the field in a moment caught by NFL cameras. "Thank you for coming, baby," Kelce said, as Swift said, "Oh, I cannot believe that." Kelce and Swift later celebrated together by singing and dancing to Swift's music at a Las Vegas nightclub.
- June 13, 2024: Swift was spotted watching Chariah Gordon's Instagram Live of the Chiefs' Super Bowl ring ceremony while on her Eras Tour stop in Liverpool, England. Gordon is the fiancée of Kansas City wide receiver Mecole Hardman.
- June 22, 2024: Kelce appeared in an Instagram post by Swift featuring a selfie with Prince William and his children after an Eras Tour show at Wembley Stadium in London.
- June 23, 2024: Kelce joins Swift on stage at Wembley Stadium for a cameo in her show.
- Aug. 24, 2024: Swift and Kelce were spotted together at her Rhode Island mansion for a weekend getaway during a break after the final Chiefs preseason game that also included Patrick and Brittany Mahomes, Jason and Kylie Kelce, Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively, Bradley Cooper and Gigi Hadid and Channing Tatum and Zoe Kravitz.
- Sept. 4, 2024: Kelce, during an appearance on "The Rich Eisen Show," confirmed a rumor sparked by Patrick Mahomes that Swift has started drawing up plays. “She is a little biased and just creates plays for me," Kelce said.

argos_summary: Taylor Swift will make her debut on the 'New Heights' podcast hosted by Travis and Jason Kelce on August 13, 2024, at 7 p.m. ET. This episode is particularly notable as Swift will unveil her new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' during the show. The couple, who have been dating for two years, have become a popular topic in both sports and entertainment, with Swift frequently attending Kelce's NFL games.
